DirSection Class Reference

An implementation of DataSection that provides a view onto a directory tree node. More...

#include <dir_section.hpp>

Detailed Description

An implementation of DataSection that provides a view onto a directory tree node.

DataSectionPtr DirSection::convertToZip ( const std::string &  saveAs = "",
DataSectionPtr  pRoot = NULL,
std::vector< DataSectionPtr > *  children = NULL 
) [virtual]

This method converts the passed section data into a zip section.

The conversion is done here to allow access to the file system (only in DirSection). A child will pass it's data to the parent and ask to be converted.

Returns:
The converted data section.

Reimplemented from DataSection.

DataSectionPtr DirSection::findChild ( const std::string &  tag,
DataSectionCreator *  creator = NULL 
) [virtual]

This method searches for a new section directly under the current section.

It first searches the cache, and returns a cached DataSection if there was one. Otherwise, it will create a new DirSection, XmlSection, or BinSection. It will return a NULL pointer if the DataSection could not be created.

Parameters:
tag Name of the child to locate
creator The DataSectionCreator to use if a new DataSection is required.
Returns:
Pointer to DataSection representing the child.

Implements DataSection.

DataSectionPtr DirSection::newSection ( const std::string &  tag,
DataSectionCreator *  creator = NULL 
) [virtual]

This method does nothing for DirSection.

The child will either be a dirsection, or an xml section, depending on whether the file has an extension. Creating of binary sections is not supported.

Parameters:
tag Ignored
creator DataSectionCreator to use when creating the new DataSection.
Returns:
A DataSectionPtr to the new DataSection.

Implements DataSection.
